description:
In this movie inspired game, you play as either Sarah Harding, anthropologist or as Roland Tembo, lead hunter of the InGen team. Harding wants to study the dinosaurs while the InGen team is intent on hunting and returning dinosaurs to the mainland.

As Tembo or Harding, you travel to 6 Nest Areas to retrieve eggs using the Game Trails. On the Game Trails you must drive and avoid the dinosaurs and other obstacles from damaging your vehicle. While in the Nest Area you have to search for the eggs. You are given Tranquilizer Darts and Harding uses Flares while Tembo has a Sonic Screamer Device to frighten off the dinosaurs.

There are 3 difficulty settings, as you select a harder setting the dinosaurs will do more damage. After you complete each level you will be given a password so you can return to that level if need be.

sample_screenshots.caption: Who will it be: Harding or Tembo?
On the hunt for some precious eggs. Watch out for mama dino!

title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park

description:
You have a choice of playing 5 different casino games following the Tiger Casino House Rules. The game you get to choose from are Video Poker, Video Black Jack, Hi-Low, Slots, and Roulette. Video Poker is a standard game of poker. Video Black Jack - get a higher total over the computer without going over 21. Hi-Low, flip a card and the higher one wins, but if you tie you have to go to War. Slots - there are 2 different slot machines to play - T-Rex and Slots O' Fruit. Roulette is a standard game of roulette.

In the options you can choose to change your starting amount and set a credit limit. When you are tired of playing a game you can cash out and the game will give you a password so you can continue your game again later.
title: Tiger Casino

description:
This is a match game using sound and pictures. You have 16 buttons with sounds and pictures under them. Given a clue, you have to match a sound and picture. If you find a match, the button will light — get four lights and the game is over. If you find the last one, you win. If not, then your opponent wins. There are three game modes:

  • Practice - Compete against yourself to get used to the game.
  • Single - This mode pits you against Henry.
  • Two Players - You can play against another person by alternating turns.

You also have the option to play with or without sound clues or visual clues.

sample_screenshots.caption: Eagle & flag but still no match

title: Henry

description: A "greatest hits" compilation of levels inspired by Sonic 2, Sonic 3, and Sonic & Knuckles. The player first selects one of the three games, each spanning multiple bosses and five levels based on one zone from the original games (Emerald Hill for Sonic 2, Angel Island for Sonic 3, and Mushroom Hill for Sonic and Knuckles). The player can then select from Sonic, Tails, or Knuckles, each of which has their unique abilities, except for Knuckles, who can neither glide nor climb. Sonic 3's bonus stage is also included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sonic ponders what he's gotten himself into.
It's the special stage!! Could there be a chaos emerald in my future?
Which game will we play today?
There are no chaos emeralds in the game. Special stages are only for points.

title: Sonic Jam

description:
The Game.Com version of Duke Nukem 3D plays more like a dungeon crawler rather than an FPS due to Game.Com's hardware limitations. The player can only move Duke forward, backwards, strafe left or right, one screen at a time. By pressing B or C the player can turn Duke to shoot left or right, but can't turn him to face that direction and move.

The game is divided in three episodes (L.A. Meltdown, Lunar Apocalypse and Shrapnel City) comprised of a total of twelve missions loosely based on the original ones of the same name, which can be accessed via passwords (given after the player dies). There are four weapons available (boot, pistol, shotgun and RPG) and four different kinds of enemies: Assault Troops, Pig Cops, Enforcers and Octobrains. Items like armor and key cards can be collected, as well as med kits and ammunition. There are four difficulty levels and the game also features Duke's digitized one-liners and other speech.
title: Duke Nukem 3D

description: The Game.Com edition of Resident Evil 2 follows much the same structure and story of its console counterpart. This version has the player control Leon by positioning him in the direction he needs to go and by having him move forward whilst engaging zombies. Leon can only be moved over three horizontal planes as in a 2D game with a side view, but with a pseudo 3D effect. Each non-scrolling location holds different zombies and once they are dead Leon moves to a new screen. He has access to an inventory to cycle between weapons. There is support for options such as touchscreen inventory menus, in addition to the game keeping track of the time the player has spent with the game.
title: Resident Evil 2

description: Indy 500 is an officially licensed Indianapolis 500 game that starts you off following a pace car leading into a rolling start to kick off the race.
title: Indy 500

description:
Based on Tiger's hit electronic toy, Lights Out is an expanded edition of the original brain-teaser. Players face a 6x6 grid (as opposed to the original's 5x5 grid) with a select number of lights lit and their goal, as in the original game, is to turn all the lights out (hopefully in the fewest possible moves). The player does this by using the stylus to touch the desired light, which will toggle it and adjacent lights on/off. Each puzzle has a certain minimum amount of steps for the player to perform in order to turn all the lights out (beginning at three and increasing by one every six puzzles). After that amount has been exceeded, the player has 10 steps to complete the puzzle or he/she will fail the puzzle and be forced to try again.

In addition to original Lights Out, two other modes of play are available - Lit Only, which only allows the use of lights that are lit, and Toggle, where the player must press a light that is lit, then a light that is not, and so on, until the puzzle is either solved or failed. There's also a Random option for all three modes, where players encounter one of up to 60 billion puzzles to solve.
title: Lights Out

description:
Poor Frog. He just wants to get home safe but must first cross a road and a river full of dangers.

The Game.com version of Frogger has two versions on the cartridge. The classic version is like the original arcade game: guide five frogs, one at a time, across a busy street and a river to the safety of his home. The second version is an updated version that contains newer levels. Some are nothing but two areas of river or road and others are one big area of road with no safe area in the middle. The Game.com also has up to four players, playing in turn.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game.Com games have a sound menu for every game

title: Frogger

description:
Batman & Robin is based on the 1997 film of the same name, in which the two titular heroes team up to stop the evil Mr. Freeze from turning Gotham into a city of ice.

The game is primarily a side-scrolling brawler. For the brawling levels, players can select to play as Batman or Robin and choose two out of a list of five items to take with them: batarangs/throwing birds and gas grenades (each with limited ammunition), a grappling hook, and, for special obstacles, an ice blast cape and ice blades. The goal in each of the side-scrolling levels is to move towards the level exit while beating up hordes of enemies with punches, kicks or the throwable weapons. Level two ends with a boss fight against the movie villains Bane and Poison Ivy.

In level three the game switches to a first-person shooting gallery. Players must take out enemies with batarangs or, if they get close, kicks, by moving a crosshair. Level four is again seen from the side, but has the selected hero scaling a wall on the way to Mr. Freeze's lair, avoiding rocks thrown by bad guys to make it to the final boss fight against Freeze.

sample_screenshots.caption: Select your hero: Batman or Robin.
The "game.com" graffiti is partially obscured by a trash can. Hmm!
The bat signal sends Batman flying into action!

title: Batman & Robin

description:
Monopoly for the Game.Com is an adaptation of the popular board game of real estate trading.

The game can be played by up to six players on one handheld. Up to five players can be CPU-controlled - each CPU player plays in a different style. There is also a head-to-head option for two human players via compete.com cable.

Some of the game rules are customizable. Standard rules like auctions, the even-build rule and transactions from jail can be turned off. Optional rules include double bonus when landing on Go, one required lap before buying, and the toggling of an infinite amount of buildings in the bank. A short game option has all players starting with the same amount of random properties.

During the actual game, the board is displayed from a top-down perspective. The center of the board is reserved for animations (which can be turned off): player tokens moving along the board, Rich Uncle Pennybags throwing the dice and events like landing in jail. The game is largely icon-controlled; the icons can be activated through the buttons or through touch input.
title: Monopoly

description:
Wheel of Fortune for Game.Com is an adaptation of the popular TV game show where contestants spin the wheel to win money and have to guess letters in a puzzle.

The game can be played by up to three players. If only one human player is available, they play against an AI opponent. Before the start of the game, the players can choose their appearance from a number of male and female portraits. The game is played entirely using a touch interface. The game screen displays the word puzzle at the top, the current player and their score in the center and the input panel (with the possible actions and a virtual keyboard for letter input) at the bottom. When the wheel is spinning, it and a close-up of the wheel values are superimposed over the game screen. The game follows the rules of the TV show, with three regular rounds and a final bonus round for the contestant who won the most money.

The game includes 750 word puzzles in more than a dozen categories.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player 2 hides his shame behind those sunglasses.

title: Wheel of Fortune

description:
Wheel of Fortune 2 is the second adaptation of the popular TV game show on the Game.Com. It is very similar to the previous game, with some minor graphical differences and a new set of puzzles.

As before, up to three players can play. There is an all-new selection of portraits for players to choose from. Game graphics and touch controls are unchanged: the game screen displays the word puzzle at the top, the current player and their score in the center and the input panel (with the possible actions and a virtual keyboard for letter input) at the bottom. When the wheel is spinning, it and a close-up of the wheel values are superimposed over the game screen. The game follows the rules of the TV show, with three regular rounds and a final bonus round for the contestant who won the most money.

The game includes a new set of 750 word puzzles, some of which are in new categories like Fictional Character or Title & Author.
title: Wheel of Fortune 2

description:
Centipede for the Game.Com is an updated version of the classic arcade game. Besides an adaptation of the original game, the cartridge also includes an updated mode with higher resolution graphics and increased difficulty. Up to four players can play taking turns.

Gameplay is unchanged from the original. The player controls a figure at the bottom of the screen that has to shoot at insects, including spiders, fleas and scorpions, and most importantly, a centipede that moves horizontally and moves closer towards the bottom of the screen when hitting an obstacle. When hit by a shot, the centipede splits into two separate sections.

Game options include selectable difficulty, number of lives and movement speed. The start level can also be chosen. There is also an option to flip the screen so the game can be played with d-pad and buttons reversed from the standard.

sample_screenshots.caption: Exploding Animation 4, looks like an electric plug
Exploding Animation 2, up close it looks like a happy butterfly
Options. There are only 3 sound effects in the game!

title: Centipede

description:
Jeopardy! for the Game.Com is an adaptation of the popular TV quiz show in which contestants must provide the questions for the answers given.

The game is for one or two players (via compete.com cable). At the start of the game, players can select their appearance from a choice of five male and five female options and can enter their name. The game is played using a touch interface. Selecting the next answer from the board, buzzing in and entering the questions is all done by tapping the appropriate icons.

The game follows the rules of the show, with regular, double and final rounds and hidden daily doubles. The overall time limit for the rounds can be turned off, as can voice samples. The game includes hundreds of answers and questions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Leo continues to rake in the dough.

title: Jeopardy!

description:
Scrabble for the Game.Com is an adaptation of the popular word construction board game.

The game can be played by two to four players, either on the same handheld, via compete.com cable, or against CPU opponents (with three difficulty settings available). Options include the toggling of the tournament timer and penalty timer and sort order of tiles on the rack.

During a game, the board is seen from the top with player scores at the right and the tile rack at the bottom. The game starts with the full board in view, but two zoom settings are available to check out the details and to place tiles via touch interface. When playing against human opponents, it is possible to challenge their constructed words. This is not possible against CPU opponents, who check their words against a built-in dictionary.
title: Scrabble

sample_screenshots.caption: This Jacky victory screen makes you appreciate the graphics of the Game.com
